text: Your uncle takes you on a trip to a nearby island in his airplane. After a nice day at the beach, you head back home. You want to make it in time to watch Dino Quest, your favorite show. Suddenly, while flying over a small volcanic island, the airplane malfunctions. Your uncle tells you to grab the parachute and jump. He will try to make an emergency landing. You hesitate, but the plane is going down. You jump. [BREAK] You reach the shore, and see the plane crash into the jungle. Your cell phone has no signal, and you are completely alone. In the distance, on the shore, you see what looks like an extinguished campfire. Perhaps someone is there.

If you go into the jungle to look for yo.text: You dive into the dense jungle. After walking for a few minutes, you see a river, and drinking water from it there is... a lizard? It stands up and starts walking on two legs. It is not a lizard, it is a dinosaur! Is it real? How can it be? You always wanted to see a living dinosaur, but now... You fear what can happen. Plus, you have to find your uncle! But having proof of a living dinosaur is something unique. Just imagine!

If you try to get closer to the dinosaur.text: You get closer and start recording with your phone. It is incredible. Suddenly, another dinosaur appears. It is a Tyrannosaurus rex. The most famous dinosaur of all. The most terrifying predator in the history of the planet. The most... The beast turns toward you. It saw you. It opens its jaws and lets out a deep roar. You start running, but it is too late. It is a shame, but no one will ever see your video.

If you go the other way and keep looking.text: You slip away into the jungle, far from that beast. After a few hours, you find remains of your uncle's small plane. You follow the trail of debris and find him. He is injured, but alive. He asks you to help him inflate the raft before nightfall.

If you tell your uncle you saw a dinosau.text: You tell your uncle that you saw a dinosaur. He tells you that he did too. For a moment he thought he was going crazy, but if you saw it as well, then it must be real. You decide that using the raft would be far too dangerous. Instead, you join forces to repair the radio. On the fifth day, you make contact with a fishing vessel. A boat comes to pick you up. Nearly out of strength, you climb aboard. You escape the island and never tell anyone that there are beasts from millions of years ago there... alive.

If you prefer to keep that a secret.text: You inflate the emergency raft and head out to open sea... until you see a beast flying overhead. Is it a... pterodactyl? The creature dives toward you with its sharp beak. You scare it off, but in the struggle it tears the raft apart. You are left adrift, in the middle of nowhere. Maybe you should have warned your uncle about the dinosaurs.

If you walk along the shore toward the c.text: You walk toward the campfire and find a girl. Her clothes are made of burlap, and her eyes are covered in red paint. She carries a bow on her back. She looks native to the island and speaks a language you do not understand. Insistently, she gestures and repeats a phrase over and over. You have your phone with you. The battery is low, but perhaps enough to translate her words, although you do not want to run out in case you get a signal later.

If you use your phone to translate her w.text: You use your phone to translate the girl's words. Luckily, you have an offline universal translator. The phone identifies her language as an ancient dialect, thought to be lost to time. You introduce yourself, and the translator repeats your words in the dialect. She does the same. Her name is Thea, and what she was saying was a warning. There is a beast nearby, a fierce monster. You tell her about your uncle. If beasts are roaming the jungle, you must find him as soon as possible. ”Come to my tribe. We can get medicine for your uncle there, if he is hurt,” she says. ”We might not have time for that,” you reply. The plane had a first aid kit, and that might be enough... if it survived the crash. She nods and says she will help you, whatever you choose.

If you follow her to her tribe.text: You accompany Thea to her tribe. There are about a hundred people, living in huts. You estimate they are natives of the island, a community the rest of the world never discovered. They tell you they once lived on a great plain, but a lightning strike from the sky brought the founders of the village to this island. You share meals and drinks with them and discover that they have dinosaurs. [BREAK] They feed and live alongside several species of herbivores. You find it fascinating. You spend an entire day while the elder prepares a medicine. When it is ready, you want to go out to look for your uncle, but a tremendous typhoon strikes the island.

If you wait for the storms to pass.text: You wait for the typhoon to pass. It lasts for several days. When you can finally go out to look for your uncle, you do not find him. You see the wreckage of the small plane, destroyed, but he is not there. You keep searching for many more days. Thea always accompanies you, and your friendship keeps growing. You search several more times, but nothing. You grow accustomed to life on the island, to the peaceful community, to the dinosaurs. You learn to use weapons and defend yourself from the carnivores. Thea and you fall in love, and you live a happy life. A life you never imagined, but a happy one.

If you go out to look for your uncle any.text: You head out to look for your uncle in the middle of the storm. Thea does not come with you. They would not let her. It is way too dangerous. You are on your own. You push through the jungle and eventually get lost. Then, suddenly, a beast emerges from the foliage. A dinosaur. Anyone would call it a velociraptor, but you know better. Real velociraptors were chicken-sized, and Hollywood made them bigger, meaner, more like the thing standing in front of you right now. A deinonychus. A murderous carnivore. You become its prey, but at least you know exactly which species killed you. Science accurate.

If you ask her to help you search for yo.text: You and Thea search the area where you think your uncle might have crashed. The sun is setting. In the distance, you see smoke, perhaps coming from your uncle's crashed airplane. The river does not seem deep, but it is wide and the current is strong.

If you decide to swim across the river.text: You decide to swim across the river. You are a strong swimmer, but the river is deep and fast. You start swimming, but the current is too strong. You get carried away. In the distance, you see a monster appear. A dragon? No... even worse. A dinosaur! You recognize the beast from Dino Quest: Allosaurus. The water pushes you toward it. You grab a branch, but it breaks. The last thing you feel is dozens of teeth, sharp as daggers, piercing your body.

If you follow the current upstream until.text: You walk upstream and climb onto a hill. You see a path and follow it. You reach an old, broken-down rope bridge. It crosses the river at a height of almost 30 feet. From there, you can clearly see smoke rising from between the trees. You call for your uncle, but nobody replies.

If you decide to cross the bridge.text: Thea says, “You go first, I will cover you,” and prepares her bow. With great care, you start crossing. But halfway across, the bridge collapses. You grab the ropes and slam against the side of the hill. Below you, a pack of beasts appears. Dinosaurs! Utahraptors. They try to climb the hillside to reach you. Thea fires arrows at them. They resist. You try to climb up. When all seems lost, a bullet cuts through the air and strikes one of the beasts. [BREAK] Your uncle appears with a shotgun. After another shot, the utahraptors scatter. You climb up to him. He is happy to see you. Thea celebrates. She shouts something you cannot understand and disappears into the jungle. Did she go for the medicine? Your uncle is badly hurt and asks you to escape on the raft before night falls.

If you decide to escape the island with.text: You and your uncle inflate the raft and escape the island. After many days lost at sea, a fishing boat rescues you. You survive, but forever live with the doubt of what happened on that island, why there were dinosaurs there.

If you convince your uncle to wait for T.text: You tell your uncle that your new friend has medicine in her tribe, and that you know she will return. You wait a couple of hours. Take the chance to connect your phone to the plane and get some battery. And in the middle of the night, Thea appears. She gives your uncle medicine and explains that something terrible is happening on the island. Bad people are creating monsters, monsters that attack her tribe. Dinosaurs, you think. Like those Utahraptors that attacked you. Perhaps these bad guys have something to do with your uncle's airplane malfunctioning. You ask where those people are. Thea says they are at the top of the volcano that rises at the center of the island. [BREAK] Suddenly, your uncle's walkie talkie crackles with noise. Then you hear a voice. ”Do not approach the volcano. I repeat, do not approach the volcano. If you hear this message, come to the southernmost point of the island, fast. Over and out.” Your uncle looks worried. ”It sounds like a trap.”

If you go to the transmission coordinate.text: You get a compass and reach the southernmost point of the island. There is a large metallic contraption that looks like a Tesla coil. Suddenly, it powers up. In the blink of an eye, a Carnotaurus appears in front of you. Your uncle falls first. Thea fires her bow, but gets crushed. You are next. Your uncle was right. It was a trap.

If you rest for the night and explore th.text: Thea, your uncle, and you explore the surroundings of the volcano in the morning. You find something striking: a fortified entrance. A massive double door made of titanium, almost hidden among the foliage. Around it, barbed wire and some metal fences, possibly electrified. Suddenly, a 4x4 truck appears along a road, and the titanium doors open to receive it. In the cab of the truck are two men. In the back, there is a cage with a dinosaur inside. A Parasaurolophus! Your uncle says “We need a plan, fast.”

If you and your uncle try to knock out t.text: Before the truck turns toward the secret entrance, you and your uncle rush forward, one to each door. You wrench them open violently and the men panic. Your uncle grapples with the driver while you lunge for the passenger. The truck jerks forward. Tires scream. Your uncle loses his footing and is dragged beneath the vehicle. There is a sickening thud as the truck rolls over him and keeps going. You freeze for a split second. A crowbar knocks you unconscious. [BREAK] You wake up days later in a hospital in your city. The strange doctor treating you speaks in a low voice. “Kid, your life is not in danger. But it could be if you tell anyone what you saw on that island. You don't want to end up like your uncle, right?” The years pass, and no one ever learns what you experienced in that place.

If you and Thea try to climb onto the tr.text: Thea and you hide along the road and jump into the back of the truck just in time. You hide beneath some tattered blankets that partially cover the cage of the Parasaurolophus, which looks sick. Thea whispers a gentle word and strokes it. Moments later, the truck comes to a stop. The men get out. There are metallic noises, and the cage moves, as if a hook were pulling it upward. Thea and you stay hidden among the rags, but carefully peek out to look around. [BREAK] You are in a gigantic cave, filled with heavy machinery, glass vats like enormous test tubes full of viscous green liquid, and many cages holding dinosaurs. Triceratops, oviraptors, even a pterodactyl. A logo is everywhere: TIME CORP. Suddenly, a skeletal-looking man enters the scene. He has long white hair, gray clothes, and black goggles. The men greet him with a bow. “This is the boss,” you think. You see two potential paths: the Lab, and the Radio Room.

If you get down from the truck and sneak.text: You slip out of the truck quietly and signal Thea to follow you. You reach a corridor and make your way to the crowded lab. You hide and listen to a conversation. “I need results, Claude,” someone says over the phone. A man in the lab replies. “The progress is incredible, Reinald. We can already bring creatures from the past. We got many dinosaur species. And we have confirmed that humans survive the trip. We brought in a couple of natives from the fifth century and even a Viking from the twelfth century.” The other voice asks, “Then why can't you bring Napoleon into the present? Or Genghis Khan? Or Julius Caesar? We could change the course of history!” [BREAK] Claude replies, “Because they were never on this island. We can choose the era, but not the geographic location. The Time Blender only brings creatures from its surroundings. That is why we must build more of them, all over the world. But we need more funding. With this, we can conquer the world. Control time!” A chill runs down your spine. You have to stop Claude from carrying out his twisted plan. You look around. The lab has a cage holding a troodon, wounded from experiments. Maybe you could sneak over and free it, letting it take revenge on Claude and end this.

If you sneak deeper into the lab and fre.text: With the stealth of a cat, you slip between the lab desks without being seen. You reach the troodon's cage and quietly undo the latch. The beast is free. It lets out a sharp screech, leaps onto a desk, and sinks its razor-sharp jaws into a man. Then it bounds toward a woman who tries to flee, grabs her by the leg, and tears into her. Doctor Claude screams, “Stay back, beast from hell,” but the animal turns on him next. Seconds later, no one is left standing. You and Thea stay hidden as the troodon disappears into the chaos. The lab is left in ruins. “Did we win?” Thea asks. “I think we did,” you answer.

If you ask Thea for her bow and shoot Do.text: You do not have time to translate everything you just heard for Thea. You cannot tell her to stand up and shoot the gray-haired man either. You decide to act on your own. You grab Thea's bow and an arrow from her quiver. You jump to your feet and say, “It's over, Claude,” while brandishing the bow. “What?” Claude asks, stunned. You release the arrow and... it drops to the floor, completely harmless. You were never very good with a bow. Although, to be fair, you did place third once in a tournament with your friends. A guard shoots at you. Unfortunately, with much better aim.

If you get down from the truck and sneak.text: From a radio room, you could send a distress signal. You signal Thea to follow you and make your way to the room, which luckily is empty. You recognize the controls because your uncle taught you how to use the ones in the small plane. You tune the transmitter's frequency and say, “Mayday, mayday...” The guards notice the transmission and try to capture you. [BREAK] Thea and you barely escape the base and reunite with your uncle. Hours later, helicopters are flying over the island. Special forces dismantle Claude's operation. But they also capture the dinosaurs, evacuate Thea's tribe, and seize the research describing time travel. When you return home, you see everything on the news. You feel a bittersweet ending. Anyway, it is time for Dino Quest.

If you prefer to stay in the truck a bit.text: Thea and you wait in the truck. TIME CORP soldiers move equipment back and forth. They talk about the new Time Blender, which is almost ready to send creatures into the future. You want to hear more, when... someone lifts the tarp under which you and Thea were hiding. “Stowaways,” says one guard. “Dinner,” says another, and you don't understand why—until they take you to a cage holding a hungry saber-toothed tiger. “Dinner,” you say. That is your last word.

If you prefer to continue uphill and sea.text: Night falls. You keep walking with Thea and, without realizing it, you step on a trap. Both of you are caught in a burlap rope net and are now hanging from a tree. Moments later, a blond man with a rough face and nearly two meters tall appears. A long beard, blond hair, and a horned helmet. A... Viking? “Ah, they're not even lizards... they're humans! Hmm. I'm not sure I can eat them. They don't look very tender,” he says, as if talking to himself. You understand his words thanks to the universal translator. The battery of your phone is extremely low...

If you turn on the flashlight so he can.text: You turn on your phone's flashlight. The light shines up at your face from below, creating a chilling play of shadows. “Black magic!” the Viking shouts, before running off in terror. It is the last thing your phone manages to translate before running out of battery. You call out to the Viking at the top of your lungs, but he keeps running until he disappears into the jungle. Hours pass, and you remain hanging in the net trap. Days pass. You suffer the heat, the hunger, the thirst... until you suffer no more.

If you open your music player and play a.text: You press play, and the power of Nordic heavy metal blasts at full volume from your phone's speaker. The Viking takes a step back and raises his axe, wary. After a few seconds, you see him start to nod his head to the rhythm of the song. A smile of fascination spreads across his face, as if the music carried the Viking blood that ran through his veins. “Ehhh!” he shouts, shaking his head and long blond hair during the chorus. When the song ends, he lowers the axe and approaches you. “Again,” he says. [BREAK] You hurry to reply, because your phone does not have much battery left. “The song will play again, but first get us down from here.” Then, your phone dies. The Viking agrees, and minutes later the three of you are listening to metal on the mountaintop. For a second, you could swear you saw dragons flying through the sky. “Grumsh,” the Viking says, extending his hand. You shake it and say your name. Thea does the same. Suddenly, it starts raining. Grumsh gestures for you to follow him.

If you and Thea follow the Viking.text: You reach a wooden shelter, his home. It is filled with odds and ends, from improvised weapons made of stones and logs to a straw bed and a campfire. Among them, you find a modern backpack with a TIME CORP patch. The Viking explains it belonged to a dead man he found on a trail. Inside the pack, you find a power bank. You charge your phone and talk with the Viking, who lights the campfire. “How did you get here?” you ask, and he explains, “I came to this island with my people. Suddenly, lightning struck and everyone disappeared. I was left alone. The gods took them. This island is cursed.” [BREAK] You wonder if that is what happened to your uncle. Then Thea says, “A lightning bolt? The legend says my people came to this island in a bolt of lightning. That is how they founded my village...”. Strange. Suddenly, you hear noises in the jungle. A beast. A DINOSAUR! Alive, but how? It's a big bipedal with stripes like a tiger. A carnivore. You know it from Dino Quest: a torvosaurus gurneyi!

If you run from the beast.text: Have you ever tried to outrun a dinosaur? Well, there is always a first time. You run at full speed and lose sight of Thea and Grumsh. Your only concern is surviving. You feel the beast's fast footsteps shaking the ground behind you. You glance back for a second and see it: its enormous jaws wide open, ready to attack you. The heavy rain makes you stumble in the mud, but you keep running until you reach a cliff. Ten meters below, a lake. You gather the courage to jump into the water. You jump. But while you are in the air, the dinosaur's teeth sink into your body.

If you take a burning log from the campf.text: Grumsh shouts that you must escape, but you answer that it is pointless, the dinosaur would catch you. “Fire should scare it away.“ Without losing a second, you grab a log from the campfire and raise it high like a torch. You swing it from side to side like a sword, and the dinosaur halts its advance. Thea arrives at your side. She tears a piece of her clothing and ties it to the tip of her arrow. Then she lights it with the campfire and shoots. The flaming arrow strikes the beast. “Well done!” the Viking shouts, joining you. He grabs an ember the size of a coconut and hurls it at the dinosaur like a bomb. The torvosaurus retreats. But you can only scare it off for a little while longer. The beast, even angrier, starts trotting toward you with its jaws open. [BREAK] You close your eyes, expecting the worst, and hear a sharp sound. A gunshot. You open your eyes and see your uncle with a smoking shotgun. He fires again and the carnivore flees. You reunite, and he explains that he heard the heavy metal song and followed your trail. When Thea and Grumsh fall asleep, you and your uncle check the TIME CORP backpack. Inside, you find a map of the island. In the north and the south there are markers that catch your attention. They look like some kind of Tesla coils, and they are labeled TIME BLENDER. When you see the lightning symbol, everything makes sense. [BREAK] “Grumsh said he was exploring this island and that a lightning strike made his people disappear. But in reality, the lightning made him... travel through time. The Time Blender took him out of his era to ours!” you say. “That explains the dinosaurs. These machines bring them from the past to the present,” says your uncle. “And the same goes for Thea and her tribe,” you add. But who is behind this? And what is TIME CORP really? “We have to find out,” your uncle says. “I would bet they are the ones who caused the incident with our plane.” “Very clever,” says someone behind you. You turn around and see two armed men. TIME CORP is written on their jackets. “Freeze!” they order.

If you raise your arms to surrender.text: Your uncle and you raise your arms, but the men shoot anyway. No bullets come out of their weapons, but tranquilizer darts that make you lose consciousness instantly. When you wake up, you are tied to a metal platform. Beside you, a Tesla coil is spilling arcs of electricity. “You know, for now we can only bring creatures from the past to the present,” says an old man with white hair and black goggles, who seems to be the head of the operation. “Every time we try to send a creature from the present to the past, there are... accidents.” You see your uncle's body tied to another platform, completely burned. “I wonder if you will endure,” the old man says, and pulls a lever. The Tesla coil crackles. The noise is tremendous. Suddenly, your entire body is on fire. A deafening roar, and everything around you disappears. [BREAK] You survived. You are in the past. There is no living being around you. No humans, no dinosaurs, no other living creatures. Not even air you can breathe. You fall to the ground, and the red sky is the last thing you see. No one ever knew how life arose on planet Earth, and no one will ever guess what became of your decomposing body. You were the first living being on Earth. And, in a way, we all descend from you.

If you signal your uncle to attack the m.text: Your uncle and you rush at the men. They fire, but the shots go wide. You knock them out with heavy blows and both guards fall unconscious. When they wake up, you interrogate them. They confess that they work for TIME CORP and that old Doctor Claude is in charge of everything. He is an elderly scientist obsessed with time travel who wants to control it all. Because if you control time travel, what is left outside your grasp? Nothing. For now, he can only bring creatures from the past to the present. And not from just anywhere in the world, but from exactly where the time machine is located: a hundred meters around the Tesla coil. Doctor Claude wants to build machines all around the globe, but so far they have only worked on this island. As if this island had some special electromagnetic signal. Thea, Grumsh, your uncle, and you listen to the guards' confession. And you all agree on one thing: you have to put an end to Doctor Claude and TIME CORP. [BREAK] Thea says she can call her tribe and that they can raid the bad guys' base and destroy the time blenders in a coordinated attack. This plan would be a direct strike. Your uncle says that is too risky and puts many lives in danger. Maybe it would be better for you and him to infiltrate the base stealthily. The map shows there is a helipad, which means they must have a helicopter, and your uncle knows how to fly one.

If your uncle and you infiltrate the bas.text: The next morning, your uncle and you are ready. You put on the guards' clothes and equipment, including the caps and dark goggles with night vision. You say goodbye to Thea. She hugs you tightly and wishes for you to return safe. Grumsh sees you off and gives you his axe. You take the Viking axe in your hands. “May the power of Odin protect you,” he says as he bids you farewell. Your uncle and you leave. You climb the volcano until you see the entrance marked on the map. “The TIME CORP base,” your uncle says. You see several soldiers arrive in a truck and unload supplies. You take advantage of the moment to slip inside. Once inside, you move through the corridors. Little by little, you reach almost the top floor. The helipad. The helicopter is there. But you also find something you didn't expect. An immense Tesla Coil. A TIME BLENDER! [BREAK] “Damn intruders,” a voice says behind you. You turn around and see an old man with white hair and black goggles. It is Doctor Claude. You tell your uncle to run to the helicopter and start it. You pull out your axe and take a defensive stance in front of Claude. “This is the new prototype,” the old man says. “Bringing creatures from the past to the present is very useful... but the ideal dream is to travel to the future, right? I finally managed to do it. I still have not figured out how to make those creatures return, but that does not matter. All it takes is pressing this button to send you to the year ten thousand, and you will never come back. What the heck, let's add a zero.” Claude says as he presses the control. “Year one hundred thousand sounds better.” The Tesla coil shrieks and envelops you in lightning. Your uncle shouts from the helicopter, which is already running.

If you throw your Viking axe at the Time.text: The rays of the Tesla coil wrap around you and numb your muscles. Doctor Claude laughs as he watches you suffer under that storm of electricity. You feel your body coming apart, as if it were about to begin a journey into eternity. But you find the strength you need within yourself. You grip the axe tightly, raise your arm toward the sky with all your might, and hurl the axe at the center of the Tesla coil. The explosion blinds you. “No!” Doctor Claude screams. You run at full speed to the helicopter and climb aboard. Your uncle lifts off. Doctor Claude approaches the Tesla coil, which spins out of control and floods the entire volcano with lightning. With a deafening roar, the TIME CORP base explodes. Your uncle flies the helicopter along the island's coast. You see Thea and her tribe waving goodbye. You see Grumsh waving as well. With a smile, you leave the Island of Time behind.

If you run to the helicopter.text: You start running toward the helicopter. You see your uncle desperately calling out to you. The rays of the Time Blender catch you and wrap around you, dragging you into the future. “No!” you shout. You try to resist. And suddenly, everything around you changes. In front of you there is no helicopter, but a ship the size of a building. The sky is red, with golden hues. Countless lights cross it from one side to the other, like a rain of stars. But they are... ships? The air is thick, you can barely breathe. A humanoid approaches you. It is three meters tall, with an elongated face and black, lidless eyes. It looks at you the way a man looks at an ant. It laughs, but you do not know whether the smile is friendly or hostile. A chill runs down your spine. Welcome to the year one hundred thousand.

If you prepare a coordinated attack with.text: Thea leads you to her tribe. The tribe numbers around a hundred people and, to your surprise, they live peacefully alongside dinosaurs. “You did not tell me you had dinosaurs as pets,” you say, unsure whether the universal translator captures what you mean. “I told you there were monsters on the island,” she replies, “and these are not monsters, they are friends.” You look around and realize all the dinosaurs are herbivores. You are flabbergasted by the sight. Some Dryosaurus are used like horses. People ride them and race across the land at incredible speed. You learn how. You never imagined riding a dinosaur, but there you are. [BREAK] The village leaders understand the threat posed by TIME CORP, and everyone agrees to prepare for a final battle. After a couple of tense days, two groups are formed: one to attack the base, another to destroy the Time Blenders marked on the map. “I will destroy those things,” Grumsh says. “I will lead the attack on the base,” Thea says. At last, the day of the assault arrives.

If you join the team to destroy the Time.text: You reach the first Time Blender, a gigantic Tesla coil. You know it is powered down because it is not firing any lightning. Grumsh, you, and a few villagers manage to take down the guards. The moment to destroy it arrives. You inspect the control unit and notice several exposed cables. “A short circuit would ruin it forever,” you say. You cut the wires and reconnect them at random. You tell everyone to move away, and you are left alone in the area. Without hesitation, you pull the lever to activate the machine. A rain of lightning engulfs you. The coil explodes, but you feel a temporal storm affecting you. It is as if you were traveling through time, and losing the memories you made over the past few days...

If you join the team that will attack th.text: Mounting a dryosaurus, you ride with Thea to the TIME CORP base at night, when guard is low. A fight breaks out against the henchmen. You dismount from the dinosaurs and enter the base. Chaos ensues. You fight your way up to the top, to the Control Room. There you find the leader of the operation: Doctor Claude. An old man, white hair, black goggles. He escapes to a wide bridge of pure metal that crosses the active volcano. In the middle of the bridge, a Tesla coil. A Time Blender. [BREAK] Claude presses a button on a remote control. The blender lights up, the lava below bubbles up. A huge tyrannosaurus appears between you and Claude. “Monster!” Thea says in her language. Your mind races. You can't let Claude escape. But how can you face a T-Rex? That big claw, those giant legs... That's it! Perhaps you can run between them. But you need a distraction. Or is it too risky?

If you ask Thea to shoot the T-Rex in th.text: “At my signal, shoot it in the eye. I will slide under it,” you say. “What? You are crazy!” Thea says, but it's too late: you've started sprinting. You get close to the beast, it opens its mouth to eat you. “Now!” you scream. Thea shoots the T-Rex. The arrow crosses the air... and strikes the beast in its left eye. For a second, it halts. It's all you need. You slide between its legs and turn back up, running at full speed. Claude screams “You fool!” and presses the button again. The coil crackles. A Quetzalcoatlus appears. “Damn thing!” Claude shouts. Then you understand: Claude can't summon specific dinosaurs. It's random! The Time Blender takes whichever dinosaur was here, millions of years ago. “Stop!” you tell him, while you run at him. “Never! I control time. I control everything!” he screams, and presses again. [BREAK] The coil crackles. Then, an Alamosaurus appears: a giant long neck dinosaur. Six times larger than T-Rex. 70 tons of pure muscle. The bridge cracks. “Oh, no” you say, and grab a handle with all your strength. The bridge collapses under the massive weight. The Time Blender and the T-Rex fall into the lava. Claude loses footing and falls as well, with a scared scream. You are about to fall, when a beast flies near you: the Quetzalcoatlus. You jump on top of it and ride it towards Thea. You grab her and glide with the Quetzalcoatlus until you're outside the volcano's mouth. You catch your breath. The Alamosaurus walks out of the volcano, its legs injured but alive. [BREAK] Days later, peace returns to the island. The Time Blenders are destroyed, and all of Claude's henchmen have fled. Thea's tribe bids you farewell as a hero, and she asks you to visit her again soon. “Of course,” you say. They wave as your uncle and you leave the island in a TIME CORP helicopter. You are happy.

You continue along a winding path that descends the hill. You are sure that this way you will reach the place where your uncle's plane crashed. The rain intensifies its fury, but you keep going. The path is slippery. Your impulsiveness gets the better of you, until you slip and your head strikes a rock. Your death is unceremonious, and your body becomes the breakfast of a family of velociraptors.

You start running as fast as you can. The beast is a deinonychus, a fierce predator known for its speed and agility. The girl shouts something in her language, but you cannot understand her. Those are the last words you hear in your life, and you never even know what they meant.
